intro: Erodium petraeum subsp. glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular erodium, is a small annual plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has small, oval leaves that are covered in glandular hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are pink to purple in color and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. This subspecies is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
